name: The Witchery by the Castle
description: Edinburgh's most atmospheric restaurant located at the gates of Edinburgh Castle. Housed in a 16th-century building with opulent Gothic decor, serving the finest Scottish cuisine and an exceptional wine cellar.
reviewSummary: Gothic glamour meets Scottish excellence in Edinburgh's most atmospheric dining destination, where 16th-century charm creates unforgettable memories.

spotlight.title: Gothic Glamour at the Castle Gates
spotlight.excerpt: Step into a 16th-century world where Scottish cuisine meets Gothic drama.
spotlight.introduction: The Witchery by the Castle stands as Edinburgh's most theatrical dining destination.

menuHighlights.Signature: Scottish fine dining in Gothic surroundings

spotlight.finalVerdict: A truly unique dining experience that captures Edinburgh's mystical charm.
spotlight.author: Edinburgh Guide

name: Restaurant Martin Wishart
description: Edinburgh's first Michelin-starred restaurant, offering exceptional modern French cuisine. Chef Martin Wishart creates innovative dishes using the finest Scottish ingredients with French techniques.
reviewSummary: Edinburgh's first Michelin star shines brightly, where Martin Wishart's modern French cuisine celebrates the finest Scottish ingredients.

name: Ondine
description: Award-winning seafood restaurant specializing in the freshest Scottish fish and shellfish. Chef Roy Brett creates exceptional dishes celebrating Scotland's coastal waters in an elegant setting.
reviewSummary: Scotland's coastal bounty reaches its peak at Ondine, where Roy Brett's expertise transforms the finest Scottish seafood into culinary art.

name: Deacon Brodie's Tavern
description: A historic pub on the Royal Mile named after Edinburgh's infamous 18th-century character. Serves traditional Scottish fare including haggis, neeps and tatties, and fresh fish and chips.
reviewSummary: Step into Edinburgh's colorful history at this Royal Mile institution, where traditional Scottish fare meets the legend of Deacon Brodie.
